name: cloudypad
description: Free, Open Source alternative to GeForce Now, Blacknut and similar Cloud Gaming platforms. Deploy your own gaming gear in the Cloud ! üéÆ ‚õÖ
readme_summary: Cloudy Pad is an open-source alternative to cloud gaming platforms like GeForce Now, allowing users to deploy their own gaming server on various cloud providers. It supports streaming via Moonlight, integrates with game launchers like Steam and Lutris, and offers cost management features such as spot instance utilization and automated shutdowns, providing a pay-as-you-go cloud gaming experience.
key_features: Deployable on AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, Scaleway, and Paperspace
No screen or virtual screen needed
Sunshine and Wolf streaming server options
Cost reduction and management features (cost alerts, spot instances, automated shutdown)
primary_use_case: Deploying and managing a personal cloud gaming server to stream games without requiring a powerful local machine or a subscription.
cover_image_prompt: A cloud architect, depicted as a friendly, approachable figure, stands before a vast, stylized cloudscape filled with game consoles and controllers. The architect is skillfully connecting these gaming devices to the clouds using glowing, ethereal cables, symbolizing seamless game streaming. Small UI elements float around the architect, displaying cost estimations and performance metrics. The scene is set against a vibrant, colorful sky with a subtle grid overlay, representing the underlying infrastructure. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines, bright colors, and a focus on clarity and accessibility.

name: browsh
description: A fully-modern text-based browser, rendering to TTY and browsers
readme_summary: Browsh is a text-based browser that utilizes a headless Firefox instance to render modern web pages in a terminal or another browser. It's designed for use in situations with limited bandwidth or on devices with low processing power, allowing users to access the web via SSH or MoSH connections.
primary_use_case: Browsing the web on low-bandwidth connections or resource-constrained devices.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a traveler with a tattered map arriving at a bustling, modern city. Instead of using a typical GPS, they're holding a simple, text-based interface on a small screen, which magically renders the city's complex information into a clear, navigable format. The interface displays street names, points of interest, and real-time updates, all in a clean, text-based style. Subtle digital particles flow from the city's infrastructure into the device, visualizing the data transformation. The scene is set at dawn with soft, diffused lighting. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and a limited color palette.

name: packemon
description: Packet monster („Å£‚Äò-‚Äô)‚ïÆ=ÕûÕüÕüÕû‚óí  „ÉΩ( '-'„ÉΩ)  TUI tool for sending packets of arbitrary input and monitoring packets on any network interfaces (default: eth0). Windows/macOS/Linux
readme_summary: Pack√©mon is a TUI tool for generating and monitoring network packets. It allows users to craft and send custom packets over specified network interfaces and observe network traffic in real-time. The tool provides features for packet filtering and detailed packet analysis, making it suitable for network debugging, testing, and security assessments.
key_features: Packet generation with customizable network interfaces
Packet monitoring on specified network interfaces
primary_use_case: Generating and monitoring network packets for debugging, testing, and security analysis.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled falconer, representing 'Pack√©mon', releasing a flock of digital falcons (packets) into a vast, interconnected network represented by a sprawling cityscape below. The falconer wears a modern headset displaying network traffic data. Each falcon carries a small, glowing data packet, and some are returning with response packets, visualized as glowing orbs. The cityscape includes subtle UI elements on buildings, displaying real-time network statistics. The scene is set at twilight, with a dramatic sky and glowing network lines connecting buildings. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.

name: tracy
readme_summary: Tracy is a real-time, nanosecond-resolution profiler designed for analyzing the performance of applications, particularly games. It supports CPU and GPU profiling, memory allocation tracking, lock contention analysis, and context switch monitoring. Tracy offers remote telemetry and hybrid frame/sampling profiling capabilities, with direct support for C, C++, Lua, Python, and Fortran, as well as bindings for other languages.
key_features: CPU profiling (C, C++, Lua, Python, Fortran)
GPU profiling (OpenGL, Vulkan, Direct3D 11/12, Metal, OpenCL, CUDA)
primary_use_case: Performance analysis and optimization of games and other applications.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled watchmaker meticulously examining the intricate gears of a giant clock, each gear representing a different part of a software application. The watchmaker uses specialized tools to analyze the movement and timing of each gear, identifying bottlenecks and inefficiencies. Tiny screens display real-time performance data and code snippets related to the gears being examined. The scene is set in a brightly lit, futuristic workshop with a clean and organized aesthetic. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.

name: openresty-manager
description: The most simple, powerful and beautiful host management panel, open source alternative to OpenResty Edge.
readme_summary: OpenResty Manager is a host management panel designed as an open-source alternative to OpenResty Edge. It simplifies the process of securing reverse proxy websites, managing hosts, and deploying applications through a user-friendly web interface and an application store. It also automates free SSL certificate management and provides tools for access control and denial of service protection.
primary_use_case: Host management and reverse proxy setup with a focus on ease of use and security.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled conductor orchestrating a network of servers, each represented by a musical instrument. The conductor uses a central panel to control the flow of data, visualized as musical notes, ensuring harmonious performance and security. The panel displays real-time metrics and security protocols. The scene is set in a futuristic control room with glowing interfaces and subtle code snippets projected onto the walls. The composition is balanced with a focus on the conductor and the panel. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.

name: ScreenToGif
description: üé¨ ScreenToGif allows you to record a selected area of your screen, edit and save it as a gif or video.
readme_summary: ScreenToGif is a tool for recording a selected area of your screen, live webcam feed, or sketchboard drawings. It allows users to edit the recordings and save them as GIFs, videos, or other image formats. The application provides a comprehensive solution for creating and editing screen recordings for various purposes.
primary_use_case: Recording screen activity, webcam feed, or sketchboard drawings and saving them as GIFs or videos.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled artisan meticulously crafting a complex origami crane from a flat computer screen. The artisan carefully folds and shapes the screen, transforming it into a beautiful, animated crane that takes flight. The crane's wings display looping animations and short video clips. The artisan's workshop is filled with tools like styluses and editing software interfaces projected onto the walls. Subtle code snippets float in the background, resembling blueprints. The scene is bathed in soft, diffused light, creating a sense of focus and precision. This conceptual illustration, in a clean, modern digital painting style, symbolizes screen recording and GIF creation with a touch of artistry and transformation.
